page.title: 16RECREATION
page.content: {Essendon Playing Field The cricket field, which lies in the centre of Essendon, is used by most of the village. There is a large open field which is used for football and cricket. Behind the field is a tennis court and in one corner a pavillion. The field is used for car boot sales and a fete on August Bank Holiday.In 1978 the village raised money to buy the field and the Field Committee decides what takes place. {Essendon Tennis Club Essendon Tennis Club was started in 1973, with a committee of eight and ninety members. A family costs Â£7.50, adult, Â£5.00 child, Â£1.00 Non-members 20p. The court needs repair it will cost Â£3,000.00.This money will be raised though subscriptions and other events.Tournaments are held.
